instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2838: What is 820-2838? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2838</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message:
Hello,
First of all, thank you in advance for trying to help me!

I have an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2838</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A
It works from the battery just fine, but it doesn’t see the charger at all. The charger has a green light.
Without the battery I have no fan spin but still a green light in the charger
I tried a different charger but nothing. The DC in port looks ok, there is power coming through.
I have measured the following S5 rails and they are all present.
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>
<SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL>
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL>
<SIGNAL>PP0V9_S5</SIGNAL>
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL>

I’m not sure where to go from here, can you help?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2838</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message: Known good IO board and flat cable is the first thing to start with.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2838</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message:
I don't have a spare one but I will find and try.
But the fact that all the S5 rails are ok doesn't mean that the IO board and the flat cable are working?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2838</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message: No, S5 will be there without the flat cable connected too. At this point you do not know if the charger is recognized really. Unless you can confirm the light will turn orange with a battery connected.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2838</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
threads.message: I got a new IO board and it worked, thank you very much!!!
